“Excellent,” says the emissary, beaming with joy, as if it’s the best news he’s heard all day. “Most people are content to live in ignorance. They never question their circumstances and accept their existence, no matter how meager, calling it their life. Few, very few make an attempt to open their minds and to ask themselves ‘what would make my life worth living?’ Thus, merely by coming here to ask some questions, you’ve already elevated yourself above many.
“Now, what do you wish to know?”

dlgAnsw.text: “What would make my life worth living?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“If I had a coin for every time I was asked this question,” smiles the emissary. “This knowledge is beyond the grasp of mere mortals. It is revealed only to those who have been chosen to receive the divine will and to share it with those willing to listen.
“Travel to Ganezzar and speak to Brother Meru. He will reveal your destiny to you.”

“It’s true that brother Meru was born a lord, but when he was called to do his duty, he didn’t hesitate to answer it. He has renounced his lordship, for only gods are above men, and became the first of those who serve the gods and do the divine will.”

“That of any father who loves his children. The truth is, we’re lost and can’t find our way. The divine will is the guiding light out of darkness and into a better world. Is there a worthier goal? Should we not do everything in our power to achieve it?”

dlgAnsw.text: “We should. If we take brother Meru’s word for it.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “And why shouldn’t we? We aren’t talking about some beggar claiming to speak for the gods to collect more coins. We’re talking about the Lord of House Crassus – the noblest of the noble, the wealthiest of the wealthy. What possible reasons would he have to make such claims?”

dlgAnsw.text: “You’ve given me much to think about.”

If you feel, even for a moment, that brother Meru is not most sincere in his beliefs, return here and I’ll give you one thousand imperials for your trouble.
“I’ve made this offer to more than a hundred men and women. Do you know how many have returned to claim their money? None.”

dlgAnsw.text: “You’ve given me much to think about.”
